means: 打算(mean的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Its new title was meant to give the party greater public appeal.
sentence.Network_cn: 新的党名意在使该党对公众具有更强的吸引力。

sentence.Network_en: I can't say any more, it's meant to be a big secret.
sentence.Network_cn: 我再也无可奉告了，这本是重大的秘密。

sentence.Network_en: Asked what she meant, she said mysteriously: "Work it out for yourself".
sentence.Network_cn: 问她是什么意思，她故弄玄虚地说：“你自己想吧。”

PerfectNetExp.abs: Unfortunately , this meant climbing a sheer hundred - foot cliff - face of solid ice ., 不幸的是 , 这意味着沿着布满了坚冰的百尺峭壁一路爬上去.
this sentence meant , presumably read in elementary school know ., 这句话的意思 , 想必读过小学二年级的都明白.
meanspirited 卑鄙的meant 意味meantime 同时
4. mean v.意思是，表示…的意思；过去式：meant过去分词：meant

list.abs: is that your father never meant to end up here ., 你父亲从未想在此停留.
Existing bans are meant to protect the child victims ., 现行的禁令旨在保护儿童受害者.
the words and what they meant ., 这些词语和他们的意思.

I meant just wanna know the market of suticase computer in your city ( Australia ) , please give me the list concerning brand , distribution and price. if price is suitable .我的意思是想了解一下在你的城市（澳大利亚)中电脑笔记本的价格行情，如果比较便宜的话，请给我相关品牌的列表，配置，价格！

entry.def: Meant is the past tense and past participle of mean .
You use meant to to say that something or someone was intended to be or do a particular thing, especially when they have failed to be or do it.

example.ex: I can't say any more, it's meant to be a big secret...
example.tran: 我再也无可奉告了，这本是重大的秘密。

example.ex: The decor was meant to keep the mind concentrated on the making of money...
example.tran: 这样的装饰布局原本是想让人们把注意力集中在如何赚钱上。

entry.def: If something is meant for particular people or for a particular situation, it is intended for those people or for that situation.

example.ex: Fairy tales weren't just meant for children...
example.tran: 童话故事不仅仅是写给孩子们的。

example.ex: The seeds were not meant for human consumption...
example.tran: 这些种子并不是给人吃的。

entry.def: If you say that something is meant to happen, you mean that it is expected to happen or that it ought to happen.

example.ex: The peculiar thing about getting engaged is that you're meant to announce it to everyone...
example.tran: 订婚的特别之处在于，你就应该让人人知道你订婚了。

example.ex: Parties are meant to be fun.
example.tran: 派对就是为了乐和一下。

entry.tran: 公认(具有某种特性或特点);具有…的名声
entry.def: If you say that something is meant to have a particular quality or characteristic, you mean that it has a reputation for being like that.

example.ex: Beaujolais is meant to be a really good wine.
example.tran: 博若莱葡萄酒是公认的佳酿。

auth_sentence.content: 'Held robust views' meant he was a bigot.
auth_sentence.res_content: 'Held robust views' meant he was a bigot.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: 'Held robust views' meant he was a bigot.

auth_sentence.content: Isn't that how Parliament's meant to work?
auth_sentence.res_content: Isn't that how Parliament's meant to work?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Isn't that how Parliament's meant to work?

auth_sentence.content: It certainly wasn't meant to be that way.
auth_sentence.res_content: It certainly wasn't meant to be that way.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It certainly wasn't meant to be that way.

Sentence.sentence: Its rough estimates are meant to draw the attention of world leaders.
The five suggestions the author gives at the end of the passage are meant to encourage people to seek harmony with the natural world.
My first year of medical school counted as my senior year, which meant I had to take three to four labs a week to get all my sciences in.
This meant of course that Doris had to tell Bass whether it was a flashing light or whether it was a steady light.
He meant that we gain personal identity as we communicate with others.

sentences.en: This restaurant is meant to be excellent.
sentences.cn: 人们认为这家餐厅非常好。
